Since October we have been hearing evidence about the relationship between COVID-19, increasing digitalisation and our social and economic wellbeing. Having now considered all the evidence, our #BeyondDigital report will be published on 21 April.
She also explained what that has meant in practice for how policy making has changed (7/7) https://t.co/HSSDCIvDfo

We heard about the the wealth of wellbeing statistics being collated by governments in the UK and elsewhere. But we also heard about the need to go beyond collecting data, and to move towards making policy decisions based on an assessment of the impact on wellbeing (4/7)
This was a point echoed by @jedeneve (3/7) https://t.co/LGv1W3OsXY
Carrie Exton from @OECD explained why there is a need for measures other than GDP when considering the potential impact or success of a government policy (2/7) https://t.co/Io0vaHZGwV

The @UKHouseofLords breaks for the Easter recess today, returning on 12 April. In the meantime, here's some highlights from the meeting we had on Tuesday, looking at how governments could make improving wellbeing a driver for policy decisions (1/7)
You can watch our session live, or on catch up, here: https://t.co/Bt8zTYGM6E (2/2)

Tomorrow at 945 am, we'll be asking, in light of the pandemic, do governments need to put greater emphasis on social and environmental contributors to wellbeing, as well as economic growth, when determining policy? https://t.co/0D9r7OB07H (1/2)
